verses.verse: To the chief Musician <WH5329> <WH8764>, to Jeduthun <WH3038>, A Psalm <WH4210> of Asaph <WH623>. I cried <WH6817> <WH8799> unto 'Elohim <WH430> with my voice <WH6963>, even unto 'Elohim <WH430> with my voice <WH6963>; and he gave ear <WH238> <WH8689> unto me.

In the day <WH3117> of my trouble <WH6869> I sought <WH1875> <WH8804> the YY <WH136>: my sore <WH3027> ran <WH5064> <WH8738> in the night <WH3915>, and ceased <WH6313> <WH8799> not: my soul <WH5315> refused <WH3985> <WH8765> to be comforted <WH5162> <WH8736>.
I remembered <WH2142> <WH8799> 'Elohim <WH430>, and was troubled <WH1993> <WH8799>: I complained <WH7878> <WH8799>, and my spirit <WH7307> was overwhelmed <WH5848> <WH8691>. Selah <WH5542>.
Thou holdest <WH270> <WH8804> mine eyes <WH5869> waking <WH8109>: I am so troubled <WH6470> <WH8738> that I cannot speak <WH1696> <WH8762>.
I have considered <WH2803> <WH8765> the days <WH3117> of old <WH6924>, the years <WH8141> of ancient times <WH5769>.

I call to remembrance <WH2142> <WH8799> my song <WH5058> in the night <WH3915>: I commune <WH7878> <WH8799> with mine own heart <WH3824>: and my spirit <WH7307> made diligent search <WH2664> <WH8762>.
Will the YY <WH136> cast off <WH2186> <WH8799> for ever <WH5769>? and will <WH3254> <WH8686> he be favourable <WH7521> <WH8800> no more?
Is his mercy <WH2617> clean gone <WH656> <WH8804> for ever <WH5331>? doth his promise <WH562> fail <WH1584> <WH8804> for evermore <WH1755> <WH1755> ?
Hath 'Elohim <WH410> forgotten <WH7911> <WH8804> to be gracious <WH2589> <WH8800>? hath he in anger <WH639> shut up <WH7092> <WH8804> his tender mercies <WH7356>? Selah <WH5542>.
And I said <WH559> <WH8799>, This is my infirmity <WH2470> <WH8763>: but I will remember the years <WH8141> of the right hand <WH3225> of Ha `Elyon <WH5945>.
I will remember <WH2142> <WH8799> <WH8675> <WH2142> <WH8686> the works <WH4611> of the YY <WH3050>: surely I will remember <WH2142> <WH8799> thy wonders <WH6382> of old <WH6924>.
I will meditate <WH1897> <WH8804> also of all thy work <WH6467>, and talk <WH7878> <WH8799> of thy doings <WH5949>.
Thy way <WH1870>, O 'Elohim <WH430>, is in the sanctuary <WH6944>: who is so great <WH1419> a 'Elohim <WH410> as our 'Elohim <WH430> ?
Thou art the 'Elohim <WH410> that doest <WH6213> <WH8802> wonders <WH6382>: thou hast declared <WH3045> <WH8689> thy strength <WH5797> among the people <WH5971>.
Thou hast with thine arm <WH2220> redeemed <WH1350> <WH8804> thy people <WH5971>, the sons <WH1121> of Ya`akov <WH3290> and Yosef <WH3130>. Selah <WH5542>.

The waters <WH4325> saw <WH7200> <WH8804> thee, O 'Elohim <WH430>, the waters <WH4325> saw <WH7200> <WH8804> thee; they were afraid <WH2342> <WH8799>: the depths <WH8415> also were troubled <WH7264> <WH8799>.
The clouds <WH5645> poured out <WH2229> <WH8776> water <WH4325>: the skies <WH7834> sent out <WH5414> <WH8804> a sound <WH6963>: thine arrows <WH2687> also went abroad <WH1980> <WH8691>.

The voice <WH6963> of thy thunder <WH7482> was in the heaven <WH1534>: the lightnings <WH1300> lightened <WH215> <WH8689> the world <WH8398>: the earth <WH776> trembled <WH7264> <WH8804> and shook <WH7493> <WH8799>.
Thy way <WH1870> is in the sea <WH3220>, and thy path <WH7635> in the great <WH7227> waters <WH4325>, and thy footsteps <WH6119> are not known <WH3045> <WH8738>.
Thou leddest <WH5148> <WH8804> thy people <WH5971> like a flock <WH6629> by the hand <WH3027> of Mosheh <WH4872> and Aharon <WH175>.
